criteria: Explanation of How Behaviors Promote Growth and Development
descriptions: The student does not identify any behaviors that promote healthy growth and development.
The student identifies one behavior that promotes healthy growth and development, but the explanation is unclear or incomplete.
The student identifies two behaviors that promote healthy growth and development, but the explanations lack detail or accuracy.
The student identifies three behaviors that promote healthy growth and development with adequate explanations, but there may be some minor inaccuracies.
The student identifies four behaviors that promote healthy growth and development with clear and accurate explanations.

The student identifies five or more behaviors that promote healthy growth and development with comprehensive, accurate, and insightful explanations. Demonstrates a thorough understanding of how these behaviors contribute to overall well-being.
The student does not provide any explanation of how behaviors promote healthy growth and development.
The student provides a vague or irrelevant explanation of how behaviors promote healthy growth and development.
The student provides a limited explanation of how behaviors promote healthy growth and development, with minimal supporting details.
The student provides a satisfactory explanation of how behaviors promote healthy growth and development, with some relevant supporting details.
The student provides a clear and detailed explanation of how behaviors promote healthy growth and development, with strong supporting details.
The student provides a comprehensive and insightful explanation of how behaviors promote healthy growth and development, demonstrating a deep understanding of the underlying mechanisms.
The student fails to identify any variety of behaviors.
The student identifies only one type of behavior.
The student identifies two behaviors that fall into same category.
The student identifies three behaviors, with only one category repeated.
The student identifies four behaviors with no repeating categories.
The student identifies five or more behaviors covering a comprehensive variety of health areas.
